alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; Morgan County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:16PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Weld, northern Elbert, eastern Arapahoe, western Morgan and eastern Adams Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 415 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout tornado along a line extending from near Briggsdale to 10 miles north of Strasburg to 9 miles north of Kiowa to 5 miles southwest of Elbert, or along a line extending from 25 miles northeast of Greeley to 59 miles west of Akron to 33 miles southeast of Denver to 21 miles northeast of Colorado Springs. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Morgan, Elbert, Wiggins, Log Lane Village, Kiowa, Simla, Deer Trail, Hoyt, Shamrock, Weldona, Leader, Matheson, Agate, Twelve-Mile Corner, Jackson Reservoir, Strasburg, Adena School, Orchard, Byers and Adena. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern and east central Colorado.
